meanings.sent1: The teacher gave a poohs look when the student misbehaved.
meanings.sent2: Her poohs expression showed she was not impressed with the movie.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a poohs glare at the noisy birds outside.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds cast a poohs shadow over the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The old man's poohs tone made it clear he was not pleased.

meanings.definition: A sound made to express contempt or disapproval.
meanings.sent1: The audience responded with poohs when the magician's trick failed.
meanings.sent2: A loud poohs erupted from the crowd after the disappointing performance.
meanings.sent3: The poohs from the audience made the comedian realize his joke fell flat.
meanings.sent4: The poohs of the wind through the trees sounded like nature's disapproval.
meanings.sent5: The poohs of the disgruntled customers filled the room with negativity.
